{"step_by_step_thinking": "Alginate is a substance derived from brown seaweed. It is used in a variety of applications, including as a dental impression material. Dustless alginate is produced by reducing the amount of dust that is produced when the alginate is mixed. This is achieved by coating the alginate particles with a substance that prevents dust from being released. This substance is a dihydric alcohol, which is a type of alcohol that has two hydroxyl groups.", "answer_choice": "C"}
